entries.meaning: A short, high-pitched sound made by a small bird.

verbs.description: cheep (third-person singular simple present cheeps, present participle cheeping, simple past and past participle cheeped)

entries.meaning: Of a small bird, to make short, high-pitched sounds.
examples: […]  a brood of ducklings, which had lost their mother, filed into the barn, cheeping feebly and wandering from side to side  […]

entries.meaning: To express in a chirping tone.
examples: O Swallow, Swallow, if I could follow, and light / Upon her lattice, I would pipe and trill, / And cheep and twitter twenty million loves.
